questions.text: Where did Cliff say dead skin goes?
questions.explanation:
the atmosphere.

	He said it goes there as dust. Frasier said that dead skin sits at a bar and drinks beer all day.

questions.text: How much did Woody say he made an hour?
questions.explanation:
$7.

	Sam said he only made $6.80. This was one of the things Sam planned to change when he owned the bar again. Everyone would get a raise.

house.

	Rebecca said that Robin always gave women a house when he broke up with them. Sam said he just gave them a made up phone number.

questions.text: What did Robin ask Rebecca in the beginning of this episode?
questions.explanation:
to move in with him.

	Of course, Rebecca said yes. Robin's house was huge and had a lot of fun things in it, which Woody liked.

questions.text: Who got lost in Robin's house?
questions.explanation:
Woody.

	Woody told them he would have been back sooner but he got lost trying to find them again. Woody was checking out Robin's executive toys.

questions.text: What was Rebecca's password to the company computer?
questions.explanation:
sweetbaby.

	Rebecca used her nickname for Robin as her password. Robin figured it out and was committing insider trading through Rebecca without her knowledge.

questions.text: What did Rebecca conclude about herself, after Robin used her password?
questions.correct: I am too stupid to live!
options: I am such an unlucky woman!
questions.explanation:
I am too stupid to live!.

	Someone said maybe it was the last bad thing that Robin was going to do. He first went over all the other bad things Robin had done.

questions.text: Who said "maybe this is the very last bad thing he'll do"?
questions.explanation:
Sam.

	Rebecca asked him if he really thought so. Norm said, "Maybe you are too stupid to live Rebecca, maybe you are."

questions.text: Why did Sam say Rebecca was not thinking rationally?
questions.correct: She was about to light a tootsie roll.
options: She thought a cigarette was chocolate.
She was rambling and not making sense.
questions.explanation:
She was about to light a tootsie roll.

	Rebecca said all day had been nothing but chocolate and cigarettes. She then said she'd "kill for a chocolate cigarette".

Carla.

	Rebecca decided she was going to turn Robin in so she wouldn't get in trouble. However, at the last minute right before she was to go to the executives, Robin appeared and asked her to marry him.
